III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation When youth was previously at the facility, a staff member
exchanged contact information with the youth.
Investigation Interview
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 01/03/2025.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 01/16/2025 at his current placement.
Youth A stated he knew Former Staff 1 from being at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention and saw Former Staff 1 at his current
placement. Youth A stated he and Former Staff 1 acknowledged
each other with a head nod and without conversation. Youth A
stated he was in the community when Former Staff 1 found Youth
A’s Instagram through his brother’s Instagram and reached out
and he obtained her phone number. Youth A stated he did not
know when this occurred but guessed it was sometime in 2023
and stated Former Staff 1 was no longer employed by Wayne
County Juvenile Detention when she reached out. Youth A
identified Former Staff 1 by the first letter of her first name and her
last name. He stated not knowing her first name.
Former Staff 1 was hired at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
01/03/2023. Former Staff 1’s first workday was 01/09/2023 and
her last workday was 10/16/2023 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention per Human Resource 2. Former Staff 1’s last known
telephone number has a message stating the number has been
changed, disconnected or no longer in service when called on
01/23/2025.
Case manager at Youth A’s current placement spoke with this
writer on 01/16/2025 after Youth A’s interview. Case manager
stated she walked Youth A back to class after the interview and
2

Youth A said he lied about Former Staff 1 giving her telephone
number to him.
Therapist at Youth A’s current placement was interviewed by
phone on 01/03/2025. Therapist stated she redirected Youth A
when he was not attentive in group. Therapist stated Youth A said
he knew Former Staff 1 and said, “I have her phone number.”
Human Resource 1 at Youth A’s current placement confirmed on
01/16/2025 that a female person with the same last name as
Former Staff 1 was on at the facility for one day in 12/2024.
Human Resource 2 at Wayne County Juvenile Detention
provided Former Staff 1’s last known telephone number based on
the first letter of her first name and last name.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Code of Ethics policy and
procedure 3.1 (I) states “Staff shall not encourage, engage in or
fraternize with any resident who received services by the Juvenile
Detention Facility (JDF), while on or off duty. There will be no
conduct whether on or off the job, that adversely affects the
employee’s ability to perform his/her current job or which
adversely affects the institution’s ability to carry out its assigned
mission. Staff will under no circumstances share personal
information. Staff will under no circumstances take pictures or
videos of residents.”
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there is not enough
information to support a rule violation of Former Staff 1 reaching
out and giving her telephone number to Youth A.
CONSULTATION
It is recommended that staff review Wayne County Juvenile
Detention’s Code of Ethics policy and procedure.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
3

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
